conclusion: Analyze the flow of liquid through the channels to determine which container (D or E) it will flow into.
Identify the starting point of the liquid flow indicated by arrows labeled A, B, and C.
Observe the direction of the liquid flow through the channels from the starting point (A, B, or C) to the next channel.
Determine which channel the liquid will flow into after passing through the baffles, following the path of least resistance.
Compare the paths of the liquid through channels D and E to determine which allows the least resistance.
Based on visual analysis, determine which container (D or E) the liquid will flow into.
